description:
Implement an undo feature for a text editor, where operations are stored in a stack.

Write a function to perform undo operations based on a sequence of edits.

Example:

Input:

3
Edits: ["Type A", "Type B", "Undo"]

Output:

Current Text: "A"

Explanation:

The last operation "Type B" is undone, leaving the text as "A".

Edge Case:

Input:
1
Edits: ["Undo"]

Output:
Current Text: ""

Input Format:

The first line contains an integer n — the number of edit operations.
The next n lines contain the edit operations as strings.

Output Format:

Print the final text after performing all the edit and undo operations.

Constraints:

1 <= n <= 10^5

Each operation is a string of length at most 10.
title: Undo Feature in Text Editor

code_skeletons.skeleton_define_class:
class TextEditor {
    public String performOperations(List<String> edits) {
